content.raw: I tried static, and the breadcrumb hovers in the air. I think it's spawned high with the intention of it falling to the ground.
content.html: I tried static, and the breadcrumb hovers in the air. I think it's spawned high with the intention of it falling to the ground.

content.raw: should we make the breadcrumb model static? Looking at the code, the breadcrumb pose is only recorded once and does not get continuously updated
content.html: should we make the breadcrumb model static? Looking at the code, the breadcrumb pose is only recorded once and does not get continuously updated

update.description:
This pull request adds the missing functionality so that breadcrumbs can be deployed and work as network relays. In particular:

1. Adds the ability to deploy up to 3 breadcrumbs in X1 and X2 \(3 bcs/robot\).
2. Updates the visibility information when a new breadcrumb is deployed.

How to test it:

1 . Launch a cave environment:

```
ign launch -v 4 cave_circuit.ign worldName:=simple_cave_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
```

2a . Deploy a robot using Ignition: You need to publish an `ignition::msg::Empty` message on topic `/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy` ~~If I remember correctly is not possible to use~~ `ign` ~~to publish an empty message. What I do for testing is to modify the~~ `publisher` ~~example in Ignition Transport. See the updated version~~ [~~here~~](https://pastebin.com/yS6s1gPL)~~.~~

```
ign topic -t "/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy" -m ignition.msgs.Empty -p "unused: true"
```

2b. Deploy a robot using ROS: You need to publish an `std_msgs/Empty` message on topic `/X1/breadcrumb/deploy` :

```
rostopic pub /X1/breadcrumb/deploy std_msgs/Empty "{}" --once
```

‌

3\. After publishing the message you should see a message like this

```
[Msg] Deploying X1__breadcrumb___0 at 2.8 5 0.13228 0 0 0
[Msg] New breadcrumb detected, visibility graph updated
```

And a new breadcrumb should appear in simulation. Breadcrumbs are represented as small orange models. If you look at the entity tree, you should also see the new breadcrumb with name <robot\_name>\_\_breadcrumb\_\_<breadcrumb\_number>.E.g.: `X1__breadcrumb__0`.

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2597955784-breadcrum.png)
‌

The [API](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/api) has been updated in the wiki to capture how breadcrumb works.

Note: A nicer version of the breadcrumb model is ready. I just need to upload it to Fuel.
update.title: Communication support for breadcrumbs - part 2

content.raw: I created  a placeholder: https://app.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/fuel/models/Breadcrumb%20Node. It still needs proper inertia and thumbnails, but it does load.
content.html: I created a placeholder: https://app.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/fuel/models/Breadcrumb%20Node. It still needs proper inertia and thumbnails, but it does load.
Created issue #379

content.raw: The `broker` uses `simTime`, which is updated in the `OnPose` callback. I'm not sure how important the correct simulation time is. Maybe we can save this change for Carlos.
content.html: The broker uses simTime, which is updated in the OnPose callback. I'm not sure how important the correct simulation time is. Maybe we can save this change for Carlos.

content.raw: There is currently no model with the name `Breadcrumb` on fuel. Should we upload the new breadcrumb model onto fuel?
content.html: There is currently no model with the name Breadcrumb on fuel. Should we upload the new breadcrumb model onto fuel?

content.raw:
just noticed comms broker subscribes to `/pose/info` topic which receives poses of all the static and non-static models, visuals, and collisions on every iteration, which is a bit of an overkill when it only needs the name of models.  

For breadcrumbs, maybe we can subscribe to `/scene/info` which gets a msg only if a new model is spawned?
content.html:
just noticed comms broker subscribes to /pose/info topic which receives poses of all the static and non-static models, visuals, and collisions on every iteration, which is a bit of an overkill when it only needs the name of models.

For breadcrumbs, maybe we can subscribe to /scene/info which gets a msg only if a new model is spawned?

content.raw: That seems to work. I committed the fix directly to this branch in 5fb9e45.
content.html: That seems to work. I committed the fix directly to this branch in 5fb9e45.

content.raw:
There seems to be a problem with updating the visibility info based on `_relayPoses`. In `void VisibilityTable::PopulateVisibilityInfo(
  const std::set<ignition::math::Vector3d> &_relayPoses)` ([VisibilityTable.cc:273](#!/osrf/subt/src/7ee55d156f3805553b6ee18c3b9a4602859da5fe/subt_ign/src/VisibilityTable.cc#lines-273)), there's a call to `VisibilityTable::Index`, but that is always returning `std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max()` because `worldSegments` is empty. I believe `worldSegments` is created only when building the LUT, so we need a different way to index relays. I'll try rounding the xyz position as in [VisibilityTable.cc:150](#!/osrf/subt/src/7ee55d156f3805553b6ee18c3b9a4602859da5fe/subt_ign/src/VisibilityTable.cc#lines-150)
content.html: There seems to be a problem with updating the visibility info based on _relayPoses. In void VisibilityTable::PopulateVisibilityInfo( const std::set<ignition::math::Vector3d> &_relayPoses) (VisibilityTable.cc:273), there's a call to VisibilityTable::Index, but that is always returning std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max() because worldSegments is empty. I believe worldSegments is created only when building the LUT, so we need a different way to index relays. I'll try rounding the xyz position as in VisibilityTable.cc:150

content.raw: I think this needs to be compared with `std::string::npos`
content.html: I think this needs to be compared with std::string::npos

content.raw: I believe we are creating new configurations with breadcrumbs as opposed to adding breadcrumbs to existing configurations, so I don't think we need this `<plugin>` entry here.
content.html: I believe we are creating new configurations with breadcrumbs as opposed to adding breadcrumbs to existing configurations, so I don't think we need this <plugin> entry here.

update.description:
This pull request adds the missing functionality so that breadcrumbs can be deployed and work as network relays. In particular:

1. Adds the ability to deploy up to 3 breadcrumbs in X1 and X2 \(3 bcs/robot\).
2. Updates the visibility information when a new breadcrumb is deployed.

How to test it:

1 . Launch a cave environment:

```
ign launch -v 4 cave_circuit.ign worldName:=simple_cave_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
```

2a . Deploy a robot using Ignition: You need to publish an `ignition::msg::Empty` message on topic `/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy` ~~If I remember correctly is not possible to use~~ `ign` ~~to publish an empty message. What I do for testing is to modify the~~ `publisher` ~~example in Ignition Transport. See the updated version~~ [~~here~~](https://pastebin.com/yS6s1gPL)~~.~~

```
ign topic -t "/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy" -m ignition.msgs.Empty -p "unused: true"
```

2b. Deploy a robot using ROS: You need to publish an `std_msgs/Empty` message on topic `/X1/breadcrumb/deploy` :

```
rostopic pub /X1/breadcrumb/deploy std_msgs/Empty "{}" --once
```

‌

3\. After publishing the message you should see a message like this

```
[Msg] Deploying X1__breadcrumb___0 at 2.8 5 0.13228 0 0 0
[Msg] New breadcrumb detected, visibility graph updated
```

And a new breadcrumb should appear in simulation. Breadcrumbs are represented as small boxes \(red for `X1` and green for `X2`\). If you look at the entity tree, you should also see the new breadcrumb with name <robot\_name>\_\_breadcrumb\_\_<breadcrumb\_number>.E.g.: `X1__breadcrumb__0`.

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2597955784-breadcrum.png)
‌

The [API](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/api) has been updated in the wiki to capture how breadcrumb works.

Note: A nicer version of the breadcrumb model is ready. I just need to upload it to Fuel.

1. Adds the ability to deploy up to 3 breadcrumbs in X1 and X2 \(3 bcs/robot\).
2. Updates the visibility information when a new breadcrumb is deployed.

How to test it:

1 . Launch a cave environment:

```
ign launch -v 4 cave_circuit.ign worldName:=simple_cave_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
```

2a . Deploy a robot using Ignition: You need to publish an `ignition::msg::Empty` message on topic `/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy` ~~If I remember correctly is not possible to use~~ `ign` ~~to publish an empty message. What I do for testing is to modify the~~ `publisher` ~~example in Ignition Transport. See the updated version~~ [~~here~~](https://pastebin.com/yS6s1gPL)~~.~~

```
ign topic -t "/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy" -m ignition.msgs.Empty -p "unused: true"
```

2b. Deploy a robot using ROS: You need to publish an `std_msgs/Empty` message on topic `/X1/breadcrumb/deploy` : 

```
rostopic pub /X1/breadcrumb/deploy std_msgs/Empty "{}" --once
```

‌

3\. After publishing the message you should see a message like this

```
[Msg] Deploying X1__breadcrumb___0 at 2.8 5 0.13228 0 0 0
[Msg] New breadcrumb detected, visibility graph updated
```

And a new breadcrumb should appear in simulation. Breadcrumbs are represented as small boxes \(red for `X1` and green for `X2`\). If you look at the entity tree, you should also see the new breadcrumb with name <robot\_name>\_\_breadcrumb\_\_<breadcrumb\_number>.E.g.: `X1__breadcrumb__0`.

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2597955784-breadcrum.png)
‌
update.title: Communication support for breadcrumbs - part 2

content.raw:
Here's a trick to publish `ignition::msg::Empty`:

`ign topic -t "/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy" -m ignition.msgs.Empty -p "unused: true"`
content.html:
Here's a trick to publish ignition::msg::Empty:

ign topic -t "/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy" -m ignition.msgs.Empty -p "unused: true"

update.description:
This pull request adds the missing functionality so that breadcrumbs can be deployed and work as network relays. In particular:

1. Adds the ability to deploy up to 3 breadcrumbs in X1 and X2 \(3 bcs/robot\).
2. Updates the visibility information when a new breadcrumb is deployed.

How to test it:

1 . Launch a cave environment:

```
ign launch -v 4 cave_circuit.ign worldName:=simple_cave_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
```

2 . Deploy a robot: You need to publish an `ignition::msg::Empty` message on topic `/model/X1/breadcrumb/deploy` If I remember correctly is not possible to use `ign` to publish an empty message. What I do for testing is to modify the `publisher` example in Ignition Transport. See the updated version [here](https://pastebin.com/yS6s1gPL).

After publishing the message you should see a message like this

```
[Msg] Deploying X1__breadcrumb___0 at 2.8 5 0.13228 0 0 0
[Msg] New breadcrumb detected, visibility graph updated
```

And a new breadcrumb should appear in simulation. Breadcrumbs are represented as small boxes \(red for `X1` and green for `X2`\). If you look at the entity tree, you should also see the new breadcrumb with name <robot\_name>\_\_breadcrumb\_\_<breadcrumb\_number>.E.g.: `X1__breadcrumb__0`.

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2597955784-breadcrum.png)
‌
update.title: Communication support for breadcrumbs - part 2
